text: Juan Carlos Pérez Góngora (born 27 August 1960) is a Mexican lawyer and politician who served in the lower house of the Mexican Congress from 2003 to 2006. Pérez Góngora received a bachelor's degree in accounting from the Universidad Regiomontana (UR) and a master's degree in taxes from the Instituto de Especialización para Ejecutivos, AC (IEE). He also has pursued doctorate studies at the Universidad Regiomontana. He served as president of the Chamber of Commerce of Monterrey (Cámara de Comercio de Monterrey or CANACO) from 1997 to 1999. Pérez Góngora was the PRI candidate for the 2009 San Pedro Garza García municipal presidency election. == References == Category:Living people Category:Institutional Revolutionary Party politicians Category:Members of the Chamber of Deputies (Mexico) Category:Politicians from Nuevo León Category:1960 births
title: Juan Carlos Pérez Góngora
